Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery amphora; interior reserved; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of bird to left (legs and part of tail with dots in added white remaining); below, frieze of large white dots with black centres between narrow black (fired brown) bands; below, part of undetermined decoration.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 39, pl. 23, no. 30)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 129, no. 24)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.104) (phase 3)
